title: FadedV1rtue
author: FadedV1rtue
content: Hello, I was wondering if anyone knows a way where I can purchase items off of amazon without kyc by sending someone the amount of crypto that a product costs, and then having them purchase the product and send it to my address. Can anyone here recommend me a service that can do this, or someone trusted that offers this kind of service without any form of kyc involved?

comments.author: OmegaStarScream
comments.created_time: February 27, 2023, 07:11:59 PMLast edit: February 27, 2023, 07:28:54 PM by OmegaStarScream
comments.body: You can use almost any gift card provider to buy gift cards[1], and buy the goods yourself. The limits are usually high.[1] https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5208530.120;topicseen

comments.author: FadedV1rtue
comments.body: I tried this already. they locked my account with $4k usd worth of giftcards in it. wasn't able to get that money back

comments.author: bitbollo
comments.body: have you ever tried: https://purse.io/shop ?it's an historical website that allow to buy goods from amazon with bitcoin (plus you can have a decent discount for each purchase...) take a look maybe is suitable for your needs https://purse.io/how-it-works

comments.author: FadedV1rtue
comments.body: Does this site require kyc on more expensive purchases, or is it no kyc across the board?

comments.author: Hispo
comments.body: Quote from: FadedV1rtue on February 27, 2023, 07:16:48 PMI tried this already. they locked my account with $4k usd worth of giftcards in it. wasn't able to get that money backI assume they locked it because in order to spend that money they require you to have an USA address registered and also a credit card linked to your account, right?Because, that is lot of money and you should try to recover it somehow.

comments.author: FadedV1rtue
comments.body: I believe I had a debit card linked, and a us address on my account. However, it was a fresh account so my transactions got flagged and my account got locked. I contacted support a few times and they were asking for more verification, but they kept saying they can't restore my account so I gave up on trying to recover it.

comments.author: bitbollo
comments.body: Quote from: FadedV1rtue on February 27, 2023, 07:33:29 PMDoes this site require kyc on more expensive purchases, or is it no kyc across the board?for what I know no, they should not ask for kyc since it's like a p2p service.https://purse.crisp.help/en/article/common-questions-about-name-your-discount-faq-19vz0j8/

comments.author: Pmalek
comments.body: Quote from: bitbollo on February 27, 2023, 07:21:13 PMhave you ever tried: https://purse.io/shop? Interesting! Thanks for the suggestion, site bookmarked. I have never tried it before.@FadedV1rtue If you can't find what you are looking for, you can create a new thread in the Services section and ask if someone is willing to make the purchase for you with fiat, while you pay the person in Bitcoin. Be careful not to run into a scammer. Doing it that way would reveal your identity if you ship the item to your house.

comments.author: LeGaulois
comments.body: Quote from: Hispo on February 27, 2023, 07:38:01 PMYou don't need to have an adress in The USA. To give you an example: I live in France and there is amazon.fr.Yet I sometimes buy on amazon.de and use my french adress...Quote from: FadedV1rtue on February 27, 2023, 07:41:05 PMBingo. Here was your mistake. Adding 4,000$ to a brand new acount on  Amazon. It's a well know flag to see Amazon locking your account.Bitrefill, for exemple, display a message to avoid adding a huge amount.I know in such case Amazon asks for document much more than the police. I've been in the same situation during 9 months, and finally got my account back by playing the idiot village card Quote from: FadedV1rtue on February 27, 2023, 07:33:29 PMDoes this site require kyc on more expensive purchases, or is it no kyc across the board?It has been years since I used the website but if I remember correctly there is no KYC verification for "Shoppers" but only for "Earners"

comments.author: mendace
comments.body: Quote from: FadedV1rtue on February 27, 2023, 07:10:27 PMHello, I was wondering if anyone knows a way where I can purchase items off of amazon without kyc by sending someone the amount of crypto that a product costs, and then having them purchase the product and send it to my address. Can anyone here recommend me a service that can do this, or someone trusted that offers this kind of service without any form of kyc involved?Yes of course, there is a service where you can also send bitcoins via LN and you receive a code that you can insert into your amzon account as a gift card.  Not just Amazon but hundreds of cards.  It's called https://bitrefill.com

comments.author: Hispo
comments.body: Quote from: LeGaulois on February 27, 2023, 08:25:25 PMYou don't need to have an adress in The USA. To give you an example: I live in France and there is amazon.fr.Yet I sometimes buy on amazon.de and use my french adress...It makes sense since you are within the European Union, however, I ask because when someone buys gift cards on websites like Bitrefill, a warning appears to whoever plans to buy cards for Amazon USA. Such warning is about the restrictions I mentioned.That is something that has stopped me from buying them in the past.
